title: Same-Sex Couples Getting Married In Oregon
teaser: A federal judge overturned the stateâ€™s ban on gay marriage on Monday, clearing the way for same-sex couples to marry legally.
contentencoded:
Same-sex couples are getting married in Oregon, now that a federal judge has overturned the state’s ban on gay marriage.

U.S. District Judge Michael McShane ruled yesterday that the law violated the federal constitutional rights of gays and lesbians.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Chris Lehman of Oregon Public Broadcasting reports.
